meanings.definition: The Christian scriptures, consisting of the Old and New Testaments.
meanings.sent1: My grandma reads the bible every night before bed.
meanings.sent2: The bible is a sacred text for Christians around the world.
meanings.sent3: When I asked my friend for advice, he jokingly handed me a bible and said, 'This is the only book you need.'
meanings.sent4: Her notebook was her bible, filled with all the information she needed to succeed.
meanings.sent5: The bible holds stories of faith and wisdom passed down through generations.

meanings.definition: A book considered authoritative in its field.
meanings.sent1: For aspiring chefs, Julia Child's cookbook is their bible.
meanings.sent2: In the world of fashion, Vogue is often seen as the bible of style.
meanings.sent3: The mechanic's bible, a manual for fixing cars, was well-worn from constant use.
meanings.sent4: To the students, the textbook was their bible for acing the exam.
meanings.sent5: In the art world, Picasso's sketches are regarded as the bible of modern art.

meanings.definition: A copy of the Christian scriptures.
meanings.sent1: The church gifted each member a bible to encourage daily reading.
meanings.sent2: She kept a small bible in her bag for moments of reflection.
meanings.sent3: During the ceremony, the couple exchanged bibles as a symbol of their faith.
meanings.sent4: The hotel room had a bedside table with a bible placed on top for guests.
meanings.sent5: In times of trouble, she found solace in holding her bible close to her heart.
